awards.title: Most Inspirational Peace Talk
awards.description: Awarded the 'Most Inspirational Peace Talk Speaker Award' in September 2016 for the Peace Talks project in collaboration with Save The Children at the Just Peace Festival in The Hague.

awards.title: WijInholland Award
awards.description: With a team of four passionate International Media and Entertainment Management students, we received the 3rd place award for the project Inholland X-Talks. The project allowed students and teachers at Inholland University to share their passion in a 5 minute TED-talk-style video.

awards.title: NHS Service Award
awards.description: I was awarded the ICS Addis Service Award in 2012 for the voluntary work I organized in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

certifications.name: Adobe Creative Cloud - Train the Trainer

projects.title: Inholland X-Talks
projects.description:
Inholland University of Applied Sciences became business partners with TEDxBinnenhof in 2015. A project team consisting of four students, including myself as the creative manager, organised the launch of the new offices of TEDxBinnenhof and organise a viewing party for Ideas From Europe 2016. The idea of Inholland X-Talks was born and we filmed around 50 students in Amsterdam and The Hague. I was also in charge of digital and social media marketing aspects of this project. The X-Talks had more than 10,000 views on Facebook in just five days which was a great success. The TEDxBinnenhof offices project included decorating, branding, and organising an opening event for the launch of the three offices. Visitors included entrepreneurs, bureaucrats, faculty and students. The final project was to organise the viewing party which consisted of a networking reception, masterclasses, workshops and announcing the winner of the X-Talks.
This was a very successful project that got the attention of the Dutch printed press (AD newspaper) and received the third place award for the WijInholland award out of more than 20 projects.
Dutch Press appearances are as below:
1. http://www.emerce.nl/wire/student-beeld-tedxbinnenhof-2016 
2. http://www.denhaagdirect.nl/studenten-inholland-den-haag-nemen-x-talks-op-in-volkswagen-busje/
3. http://deposthoorn.nl/nieuws/x-talks-in-busje-bij-inholland-1.5779951 
4. http://tedxbinnenhof.com/inholland-organises-viewing-events-in-the-hague-and-diemen/

company.name: Hogeschool Inholland / Inholland University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description:
As a Lecturer, I have been teaching subjects with a focus on audiovisual communication such as graphic design, marketing and promotion, and video production. Since January 2020, I have taken on the role of Module Leader, where I am responsible for organizing the module and leading a team of lecturers to deliver high-quality education. I also work as a Learning, Placement, and Personal Development Coach, where I guide students through their placement (internship) and personal development journeys.

I am passionate about teaching and committed to helping students achieve their full potential.
profile_positions.title: Module Leader | Lecturer | Learning, Placement and Personal Development Coach

profile_positions.description:
As an AV Administrator, I managed the AV Centre of Inholland The Hague campus, overseeing the maintenance of AV equipment and ensuring that the AV facilities were operational and up to date. In addition, I assisted students with AV-related matters, providing technical support and troubleshooting assistance as needed.

During my time as an AV Administrator, I implemented a range of improvements to the AV Centre, such as upgrading the equipment and introducing new software to enhance the students' experience. Through my work as an AV Administrator, I developed a strong understanding of the technical aspects of AV equipment and the importance of providing high-quality support to students. I am proud of the work I did to improve the AV Centre, and I believe that my experience in this role has prepared me well for my current role as a Lecturer and Module Leader at Inholland University of Applied Sciences.
profile_positions.title: Audio Visual Center Administrator

profile_positions.description:
As a Lab Coordinator for the Sustainable Media Lab at Inholland, I was responsible for facilitating positive change and impact outcomes for a better and more sustainable world. Located in the heart of The Hague, the Sustainable Media Lab brings together leading researchers, practitioners, and students to explore what more sustainable media systems could look like.

In my role as Lab Coordinator, I was the linking pin between students, lecturers, the lab director, and professors. I worked closely with the lab team to help start up the lab and establish it as a leading center for sustainable media research and innovation.

Specifically, I facilitated communication and collaboration between stakeholders, organized lab activities and events, and helped develop and implement sustainable media strategies. Through my work, I gained valuable experience in project management, stakeholder engagement, and sustainability, which will be instrumental in my future endeavors.
profile_positions.title: Living Lab Coordinator

profile_positions.location: Inholland University of Applied Sciences in The Hague
profile_positions.description:
As an International Media and Entertainment Management student, I began my journey at Inholland University of Applied Sciences as a Student Promoter. In this role, I promoted the university at various promotional events and also gave introductory lessons on design to prospective undergraduate students. In addition, I worked on creating and publishing marketing materials using my skills in web and graphic design.

Throughout my student life, I was actively involved in various initiatives. I organised events to bring students from different studies together and led several projects, including 'Culture Talks with UNESCO,' 'X-Talks with TEDxBinnenhof,' and the 'KPN Concepts Competition.' These initiatives helped me to develop strong leadership and organizational skills.

As a Student Promoter, I gained valuable experience in marketing and promotion, as well as in web and graphic design. I am proud of the contributions I made to Inholland University of Applied Sciences during my time as a Student Promoter, and I believe that my experience in this role has been instrumental in preparing me for my subsequent roles as an AV Administrator, Lecturer, and Module Leader.Throughout my student life, I organised events to bring students from different studies together and led several projects such as ‘Culture Talks with UNESCO’, ‘X-Talks with TEDxBinnenhof’, ‘KPN Concepts Competition’.
profile_positions.title: Student Promoter

profile_positions.description:
As a Research and Design Intern at The New Agency, I worked on developing marketing strategies for B2B social media networks. This experience was a part of my International Media and Entertainment Management programme at Inholland University of Applied Sciences, and I also wrote a part of my graduation research proposal while interning at TNA.

During my time at TNA, I conducted extensive research on B2B social media networks and developed innovative marketing strategies to help clients optimize their social media presence. I also worked closely with the design team to create compelling visual content that aligned with the marketing strategies I had developed.
profile_positions.title: Research and Design Intern

profile_positions.description:
As a Marketing, Communication, and Visualisation Intern at Inholland University of Applied Sciences, I gained valuable experience in developing and implementing marketing and communication strategies for the institution. In this role, I was responsible for creating visual content, designing marketing materials, and managing social media channels.

I worked on various marketing and communication projects, including producing videos, designing flyers and posters, and developing social media campaigns. I also collaborated with different departments within the university to support their marketing and communication efforts, including events and student recruitment activities.

Through my internship, I gained practical skills in graphic design, video production, social media management, and content creation. I also learned about the importance of clear and effective communication in promoting an organization and engaging its stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Marketing, Communication and Visualisation Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
As a Marketing Communications Volunteer for the World Wildlife Fund for The Nature, The Hague Expats Team, I offered my expertise in marketing, communication, and graphic design to support the team's outreach and engagement efforts. In this role, I worked closely with the team to develop and implement various marketing and communication strategies to promote the organization's mission and raise awareness about environmental issues.

Through my volunteer work, I gained practical experience in marketing and communication, including graphic design, social media management, and content creation. I also developed a deeper understanding of the importance of environmental conservation and the role that organizations like the World Wildlife Fund for The Nature play in protecting our planet.

As a Volunteer at the Amnesty International Student Group in The Hague, I was responsible for marketing and events. In this role, I supported the organization's mission to promote human rights and raise awareness about social justice issues.

My responsibilities included developing marketing materials such as posters, flyers, and social media content to promote events and initiatives organized by the group. I also provided support for event planning and management, helping to coordinate logistics and ensure a smooth and successful event.

As a Red Cross Youth volunteer, I had the opportunity to create a new project in collaboration with the International School of Latvia. The project involved coordinating weekly hospital visits and providing support to children in need, bringing positive energy and emotional support to them during their hospital stay.

In this role, I was responsible for coordinating with the hospital staff and ensuring that visits were organized smoothly and efficiently. I also worked closely with the children and their families, providing emotional support and helping to brighten their days during a difficult time.

During my high school years in Addis Ababa, I dedicated almost two school years to volunteering at SOS Children's Village in Addis Ababa. As part of a team of three students, I visited the school on a weekly basis and worked to make a positive impact, one small step at a time. Our focus was on teaching English to the children and exploring creative arts and crafts with them.

As part of a group of classmates, I volunteered every other week at the Burn Care Unit at the Myung Sung Christian Medical Centre (also known as the Korean Hospital) in Addis Ababa. Our goal was to engage with the children and assist them in keeping up with their studies while they were receiving treatment at the hospital.
